Key Match Events: Utah's defense tightened up in the second quarter, allowing them to regain the lead.
Brice Sensabaugh's 27 points led all scorers.
Sensabaugh's 8-0 scoring run helped Utah's lead grow to 20 points with five minutes remaining.
Utah held Orlando to 43 points on 34.5 percent shooting from the field in the first half.
Orlando struggled from the field, shooting 35.7 percent overall and 29.8 percent from beyond the arc.
Post-Match Reflections: Jazz head coach Will Hardy said, 'I thought our team did a pretty good job of maintaining a level head, even through some mistakes.'
Hardy added, 'This was a team win. I thought everybody who went in the game had moments. That's what a team is and that's what we want to be.'
Hardy said of Brice Sensabaugh, 'I thought it was a big step for him, his confidence, and his belief to have this game two nights in a row.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Jazz were significantly shorthanded on Sunday night, with several starters on both sides missing the game.
Utah's bench unit produced 27 of their 43 points in the first half.
Orlando's bench wasn't as productive in the first half, but key contributions from Wendell Carter Jr. and Jett Howard kept the game close during the early stages of action.
Others: Utah returns home to face the Atlanta Hawks Tuesday night (7 p.m. MT, Jazz+).
Walker Kessler had 14th double-double of the season with 10 points, 17 rebounds, and two assists in 29 minutes of action.
